content: the twitterpation cowl a few months ago maybe a bit before the holidays a neckwear swap was organized through twitter to be culminated in february i joined up then kind of forgot about it and then february came and i panicked holy crap i have to make something i call it twitterpation because it was designed for a swap initiated on twitter and the urban dictionary defines twitterpated as follows 1 to be completely enamored with someone/something 2 the flighty exciting feeling you get when you think about/see the object of your affection 3 romantically excited i e aroused 4 the ever increasing acceleration of heartbeat and body temperature as a result of being engulfed amidst the exhilaration and joy of being/having a romantic entity in someone s life heh anyway it s super easy and if you know how to chain single_crochet and double_crochet you are good to go this cowl is crocheted flat and then sewn together for a cowl 11 5 inches in diameter and 8 5 inches tall materials dk weight yarn approximately 250 yards i used 2 skeins of knitpicks gloss dk in gulfstream size h 5 00mm crochet hook sewing needle abbreviations chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet chain 105 chains row 1 right side double_crochet in fourth chain from hook 2 double_crochet in each of next2 chs skip next chain double_crochet in next chain 5 times *skip next chain 2 double_crochet in each of next 6 chs skip next chain double_crochet in next chain 5 times repeat from * across to last 4 chs skip next chain 2 double_crochet in each of last 3 chs turn row 2 chain 1 single_crochet in each double_crochet across turn row 3 ch3 double_crochet in first single_crochet 2 double_crochet in each of next 2 single_crochet skip next single_crochet double_crochet in next single_crochet 5 times *skip next single_crochet 2 double_crochet in each of next 6 single_crochet skip next single_crochet double_crochet in next single_crochet 5 times repeat from *across to last 4 single_crochet skip next single_crochet 2 double_crochet in each of last 3 single_crochet repeat row 2 and 3 10 times break yarn leaving a 10 inch end and pull through loop thread yarn end and with right sides together form a tube and sew up the side of the cowl then with cowl still inside out and starting from seamed edge single_crochet in each of the foundation chains you want to simulate the top edge of the cowl and you are done pattern and images © 2011 by maryse roudier
